intro: Randia graeffei var. alba, commonly known as white randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white, tubular flowers. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. The white flowers are typically visited by various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
